message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the theoretical understanding of deep learning and its mysteries about optimization and generalization, which are central topics in the field of machine learning. The paper specifically focuses on the behavior of convolutional neural nets in the infinite width limit trained by gradient descent, which is a topic that falls under the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Additionally, the paper introduces a new benchmark for the performance of a pure kernel-based method on CIFAR-10, which is a standard dataset in computer vision, and thus falls under the sub-category of cs.CV (Computer Vision). The paper also connects deep learning to notions such as Gaussian processes and kernels, which are topics that fall under the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.IT (Information Theory).
